title: Clinical Applications of Active Inference
description: Application of Active Inference to understanding and treating mental health disorders from a computational perspective.
learning_objectives: Understand mental disorders through Active Inference lens
Design computational models of mental health

content.overview: Active Inference provides a computational framework for understanding mental health disorders as disruptions in predictive processing. This approach, known as computational psychiatry, models symptoms as aberrant belief updating, prediction errors, and free energy minimization.

computational_psychiatry.belief_dynamics: Aberrant belief updating in mental illness

schizophrenia.negative_symptoms: Reduced motivation as high expected free energy

anxiety_disorders.avoidance_behavior: Actions that minimize anxiety but reduce information
anxiety_disorders.intolerance_of_uncertainty: Low epistemic value for uncertain situations

depressive_disorders.rumination: Excessive belief updating about negative events
depressive_disorders.hopelessness: Belief that actions cannot improve outcomes

examples.name: Schizophrenia Model
examples.components: Aberrant precision, prediction errors, and belief updating
examples.predictions: Hallucinations when sensory precision is low
examples.treatment: Medications that restore normal precision weighting
examples.validation: fMRI studies of prediction error responses

examples.name: Anxiety Treatment
examples.description: Active Inference approach to anxiety therapy
examples.model: Patient model with high threat prediction precision
examples.mechanism: Learning that feared outcomes are less likely

autism_spectrum_disorders.predictive_coding_deficits: Impaired prediction in social and nonsocial domains
autism_spectrum_disorders.repetitive_behaviors: Reduced exploration due to high uncertainty costs

personality_disorders.narcissistic_pd: Inflated self-importance and lack of empathy
personality_disorders.avoidant_pd: Social inhibition due to fear of rejection
personality_disorders.active_inference: Disordered beliefs about self and others

addiction_and_compulsive_disorders.relapse: Return to drug-seeking under stress or cues

neural_mechanisms.dopamine_system: Prediction error and expected free energy signaling

interactive_exercises.description: Model mental disorder using Active Inference

interactive_exercises.description: Simulate treatment effects on cognitive model
interactive_exercises.scenario: Patient with specific symptoms and treatment approach
interactive_exercises.task: Predict treatment outcomes and identify mechanisms

research_methods.neural_imaging: fMRI, EEG studies of prediction processes

ethical_considerations.clinical_translation: Ensure models lead to better treatments

future_directions.precision_psychiatry: Individualized treatment based on computational models

common_misconceptions.misconception: Mental disorders are just brain diseases
common_misconceptions.clarification: Active Inference shows disorders involve complex belief dynamics
Symptoms reflect attempts to minimize free energy

common_misconceptions.misconception: Treatment is just about reducing symptoms
common_misconceptions.clarification: Treatment should restore healthy inference processes
